intro: Palicourea brachyloba, commonly known as the short-leaf palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are usually arranged oppositely along the stems. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
